case_title: Fazal-ur-Rehman, JMAQSOOD AHMED vs THE STATE
laws_referenced: Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997 - Section 9(c)
Criminal Procedure Code (Cr.P.C.) - Section 103, Section 342, Section 382(b)

facts_summary.accused_residence: Rented house shared with parents and other tenants

raid_details.conducted_by: Police party led by Rasool Bakhsh (S.H.O.) and supervised by DSP/SDPO

trial_details.charge: Section 9(c) of Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997

defense_claims.disputed_recovery: Claimed narcotics were recovered from a godown belonging to another tenant, Ghulam Farooq
defense_claims.allegations_against_police: False implication due to non-payment of bribe

court_response.validity_of_search: Section 25 of Control of Narcotic Substances Act overrides Section 103 Cr.P.C.

appeal_outcome.dismissal_reason: Prosecution proved possession and involvement beyond reasonable doubt
appeal_outcome.sentence_review: No enhancement due to lack of State appeal
